title: Miri detects a violation of stacked borrows when joining &str with -Zmiri-tag-raw-pointers
body:
Originally found by @5225225, I'm just the one with energy at the moment to write this up. I tried this code: ```rust fn main() { ["", ""].join(" "); } ``` `MIRIFLAGS="-Zmiri-tag-raw-pointers" cargo miri run` I expected to see this happen: Miri does not detect UB Instead, this happened: Miri detects UB (experimentally) ``` error: Undefined Behavior: trying to reborrow for Unique at alloc1190, but parent tag <2797> does not have an appropriate item in the borrow stack --> /home/ben/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/slice/mod.rs:421:18 | 421 | unsafe { &mut *index.get_unchecked_mut(self) } | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ trying to reborrow for Unique at alloc1190, but parent tag <2797> does not have an appropriate item in the borrow stack | = help: this indicates a potential bug in the program: it performed an invalid operation, but the rules it violated are still experimental = help: see https://github.com/rust-lang/unsafe-code-guidelines/blob/master/wip/stacked-borrows.md for further information ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.59.0-nightly (acbe4443c 2021-12-02) binary: rustc commit-hash: acbe4443cc4c9695c0b74a7b64b60333c990a400 commit-date: 2021-12-02 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.59.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ```
